type.help: STMOD+ connected modem can be either STMOD_UG96 or STMOD_BG96

sim_selection.help: Module sim selection. 0 for plastic sim, 1 for esim.

mdmdtr.help: Modem's Data Terminal Ready. Usually not connected to STMOD+ connector. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise

simsel0.help: Module sim select pin 0. By default connected to STMOD+ pin 18. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise

simsel1.help: Module sim select pin 1. By default connected to STMOD+ pin 8. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise

sim_reset.help: Module sim reset pin. Used for sim selection sequence. By default connected to STMOD+ pin 17. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise

sim_clk.help: Module sim clock pin. Used for sim selection sequence. By default connected to STMOD+ pin 13. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise

sim_data.help: Module sim data pin. Used for sim selection sequence. By default connected to STMOD+ pin 19. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise

power.help: Modem's power key. By default connected to STMOD+ pin 9. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise

reset.help: Modem's reset. By default connected to STMOD+ pin 12. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise

tx.help: TX pin for serial connection. STMOD pin 2 is the default STMOD+ UART TX. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise

rx.help: RX pin for serial connection. STMOD pin 3 is the default STMOD+ UART TX. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise.

rts.help: RTS pin for serial connection. STMOD pin 4 is the default STMOD+ UART RTS. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise.

cts.help: CTS pin for serial connection. STMOD pin 1 is the default STMOD+ UART RTS. It needs to be set/overwritten otherwise.
